de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core

Class FeatureModelAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core.FeatureModelAnalyzer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IEventListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExtendedFeatureModelAnalyzer

    public class FeatureModelAnalyzer
extends java.lang.Object
implements IEventListener
    A collection of methods for working with IFeatureModel will replace the corresponding methods in IFeatureModel
    Author:
    Soenke Holthusen, Florian Proksch, Stefan Krueger, Marcus Pinnecke (Feature Interface)

        public boolean calculateFeatures

        public boolean isValid()

        Throws:

      • checkImplies

        public boolean checkImplies(java.util.Collection<IFeature> a,
                            java.util.Collection<IFeature> b)
                     throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

        Returns whether the conjunction of A always implies the disjunction of B in the current feature model.

        In other words, the following satisfiability query is checked: 

        TAUT(FM ⇒ ((∧a∈A a) ⇒ (∨b∈B
 b)))

        Note that this formula is always true if B is empty.

        Parameters:
        a - set of features that form a conjunction
        b - set of features that form a disjunction
        Returns:
        whether the conjunction of A always implies the disjunction of B in the current feature model
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

      • checkIfFeatureCombinationNotPossible

        public boolean checkIfFeatureCombinationNotPossible(IFeature a,
                                                    java.util.Collection<IFeature> b)
                                             throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

      • checkCondition

        public boolean checkCondition(Node condition)
        checks some condition against the feature model. use only if you know what you are doing!
        Returns:
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

      • areMutualExclusive

        @Deprecated
public boolean areMutualExclusive(java.util.Collection<IFeature> context,
                                              java.util.Collection<java.util.Set<IFeature>> featureSets)
                                       throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
        Deprecated. 
        Checks whether the given featureSets are mutually exclusive in the given context and for the current feature model. In detail it is checked whether FM => (context => (at most one of the featureSets are present)) is a tautology. Here is an example for a truth table of AT_MOST_ONE_THE_FEATURESETS_ARE_PRESENT for three feature sets A, B and C: A B C result ------------------------ T T T F T T F F T F T F T F F T F T T F F T F T F F T T F F F T If you want to check XOR(featureSet_1, ..., featureSet_n) you can call areMutualExclusive() && !mayBeMissing().
        Parameters:
        context - context in which everything is checked
        featureSets - list of feature sets that are checked to be mutually exclusive in the given context and for the current feature model
        Returns:
        true, if the feature sets are mutually exclusive || false, otherwise
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

      • mayBeMissing

        @Deprecated
public boolean mayBeMissing(java.util.Collection<IFeature> context,
                                        java.util.Collection<java.util.Set<IFeature>> featureSets)
                                 throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
        Deprecated. 
        Checks whether there exists a set of features that is valid within the feature model and the given context, so that none of the given feature sets are present, i.e. evaluate to true. In detail it is checked whether there exists a set F of features so that eval(FM, F) AND eval(context, F) AND NOT(eval(featureSet_1, F)) AND ... AND NOT(eval(featureSet_n, F)) is true. If you want to check XOR(featureSet_1, ..., featureSet_n) you can call areMutualExclusive() && !mayBeMissing().
        Parameters:
        context - context in which everything is checked
        featureSets - list of feature sets
        Returns:
        true, if there exists such a set of features, i.e. if the code-fragment may be missing || false, otherwise
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

      • exists

        @Deprecated
public boolean exists(java.util.Collection<IFeature> features)
                           throws org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException
        Deprecated. 
        Checks whether there exists a set of features that is valid within the feature model, so that all given features are present. In detail it is checked whether there exists a set F of features so that eval(FM, F) AND eval(feature_1, F) AND eval(feature_n, F) is true.
        Parameters:
        features -
        Returns:
        true if there exists such a set of features || false, otherwise
        Throws:
        org.sat4j.specs.TimeoutException

      • commonFeatures

        @Deprecated
public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> commonFeatures(long timeout,
                                                                         java.lang.Object... selectedFeatures)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the list of features that occur in all variants, where one of the given features is selected. If the given list of features is empty, this method will calculate the features that are present in all variants specified by the feature model.
        Parameters:
        timeout - in milliseconds
        selectedFeatures - a list of feature names for which
        Returns:
        a list of features that is common to all variants

      • getCnf

        public Node getCnf()

        Returns the feature model as a formula in conjunctive normal form. Creates it first if necessary.

        As this is a cached mutable object, care must be taken not to modify the returned object or any of its children. If changes are necessary, the returned object must be cloned first.

        Returns:
        the feature model as a formula in conjunctive normal form; not null
        See Also:
        #getNode()} if the formula does not have to be in conjunctive normal form

      • getExplanation

        public Explanation<?> getExplanation(IFeatureModelElement modelElement)
        Returns an explanation why the given feature model element is defect.
        Parameters:
        modelElement - potentially defect feature model element; not null
        Returns:
        an explanation; null if it cannot be explained

      • getVoidFeatureModelExplanation

        public DeadFeatureExplanation getVoidFeatureModelExplanation()
        Returns an explanation why the feature model is void. That is the same explanation for why its root feature is dead.
        Returns:
        an explanation; null if it cannot be explained
